purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 绳)
Pictophonetic: 黽 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
繩索 [ shéng suǒ ]: rope
繩之以法 [ shéng zhī yǐ fǎ ]: to punish according to the law; to bring to justice

    • 黽 [ miǎn ] frog, toad; to strive, to endeavor
heisig_chinese_memo: The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a straw rope, but all that's left of the rope are some torn threads, and the unbound tortoise is nowhere to be found.
Ru_trainchinese:
shéng: (сущ) веревка, канат, шнур, трос
shéng: (графема) отбивочный шнур; критерий, закон; ограничивать, сдерживать; (книжн.) продолжать
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spidey decides to shoots rope instead of webs and powers a jet pack with his electrical outlet so he can fly instead of slinging around everywhere.
humanum_full_description_en:
The original meaning of " string " has two theories , one is the same as in the oracle bone inscriptions ( Tunjia 2031), from "糸", "黾", from the word " Ge " (Rao Zongyi), and later written as "憴", meaning jie愼, For example, in the "Book of Songs", "Sheng Qi Zu Wu", " Sheng " is taught as " Ji ", three poems "Shen Qi Zu Wu", " Sheng " is pronounced Shen. One says to save the sound from " shito " and " fly ". The original meaning is a rope, that is, a strip made of fiber or metal. "Shuowen": "Suoye. From Shitou, save the sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Rope can be used for county, can be tied, can be leisure. Therefore, "Shixun" says: "Jing Jing, rope rope, quit "Zhou Nan" Chuan said: "Ring rope, quit stunned." Cong Shi, fly and save the sound."

The pre-Qin classics use the meaning of "rope", such as "Yi·Xi Cixia": "The ancient times ruled by knotting the rope, the later sages used the book to deed." This meaning is also used in bamboo and silk texts, such as "Mawangdui. "Lao Zi Jiaben An Ancient Lost Book" 375: "It's only (Ah)! The ruler of the law and the minister. The wood is straight, and the rope can be sinned. Can wood invade the rope?"

The " rope " is also used as a rope ink, that is, the ink bucket, a tool used by carpenters to straighten up. For example, "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "The rope is straight in the wood, and you think it is a wheel." This also leads to the meaning of the " rope " of straightness, integrity and standards. The meaning of "straight and righteousness" can be found in "Lu Shichunqiu·Legendary": "The rope is pure and incorruptible, and the poorer the more prosperous." Gao You's note: "The rope is righteous." ："Qi Zuo Hou Tu, hold the rope to make the Quartet.", also seen in "Mawangdui. Laozi's Old Unknown Book in the First Book of Volume 1: "The Dharma is to lead gains and losses with ropes."

" Rope " can also be extended to the meaning of measurement and measurement. Such as "Mawangdui. "Lao Zi Jia's Old Book" 354: "Please explain the law of the ministers, and use the ropes to adapt to the crimes of the ministers"; it can also be extended to correct and correct the meaning, such as "Shu Mingming": "Rope to correct errors." Kong Yingda Shu: "The rope is right."

" Rope " can also be used for restraint and sanction. For example, the idiom "bring to law" uses this meaning.
humanum_short_description_en: One reads with " Sheng ", the original meaning as a warning Shen; one reads from " Shito ", " fly " provincial sound, the original meaning for the rope.
humanum_full_description:
「繩」之本義有兩說，一曰同於甲骨文（屯甲2031）從「糸」從「黽」從「戈」之字（饒宗頤），後寫作「憴」，義為戒愼，如《詩經》「繩其祖武」，「繩」訓為「戒」，三家詩作「慎其祖武」，「繩」讀為慎。一曰從「糸」，「蠅」省聲，本義為繩索，即纖維或金屬擰成的條狀物。《說文》：「索也。从糸，蠅省聲。」段玉裁注：「繩可以縣，可以束，可以爲閑。故《釋訓》曰：『兢兢、繩繩，戒也。』《周南》傳曰：『繩繩、戒愼也。』从糸，蠅省聲。」

　　先秦典籍用「繩索」義，如《易·繫辭下》：「上古結繩而治，後世聖人易之以書契」。簡帛文字亦用此義，如《馬王堆．老子甲本卷後古佚書》375：「至矣才（哉）！法君法臣。木直，繩弗能罪也。木其能侵繩乎？」

　　「繩」也用作繩墨，即墨斗，木匠用以正曲直的工具。如《荀子·勸學》：「木直中繩，輮以為輪」。由此亦引申出「繩」的直、正和準則之義。「直、正」義見於《呂氏春秋·離俗》：「潔白清廉中繩，愈窮愈榮。」高誘注：「繩，正也。」「準則」義見於《淮南子·天文》：「其佐后土，執繩而制四方。」，也見於《馬王堆．老子乙本卷前古佚書》1：「法者，引得失以繩」。

　　「繩」還可引申為度量、衡量之義。如《馬王堆．老子甲本卷後古佚書》354：「請明臣法，以繩適臣之罪」；也可引申為糾正、彈正之義，如《書·冏命》：「繩愆糾謬。」孔穎達疏：「繩謂彈正。」

　　「繩」也可用作約束、制裁，如成語「繩之以法」即用此義。
humanum_short_description: 一曰同「憴」，本義為戒愼；一曰從「糸」，「蠅」省聲，本義為繩索。

繩字的基本解释

繩
shéng
见“绳”。

繩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shéng］
［《廣韻》食陵切，平蒸，船。］
亦作“縄1”。“绳1”的繁体字。
(1)绳子。
(2)木工用以测定直线的墨线。
(3)直；正。
(4)准则；法度。
(5)衡量。
(6)纠正；弹劾。
(7)引申为制裁。
(8)约束。
(9)捆缚。
(10)称誉。
(11)继承。
(12)古代称深衣后幅居中的衣缝。
(13)水名。即今金沙江。参阅《汉书·地理志上》、北魏郦道元《水经注·若水》。
(14)清代旗田的计量单位。
[②]［yìng］
［《集韻》以證切，去證，以。］
亦作“縄2”。“绳2”的繁体字。
草结籽。《周礼·秋官·薙氏》：“秋繩而芟之。”郑玄注：“含實曰繩。”陆德明释文：“繩音孕，以證反。”
[③]［mǐn］
［《集韻》弭盡切，上準，明。］
亦作“縄3”。“绳3”的繁体字。
见“繩3繩”。

繩字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　繩； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页940第04
【廣韻】食陵切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】神陵切，?音乗。【說文】索也。【急就篇註】繩謂紨兩股以上。總而合之者也。一曰麻絲曰繩，草謂之索。【易·繫辭】上古結繩而治。【書·說命】惟木從繩則正。【禮·經解】繩墨之於曲直。【前漢·律歷志】規圓生矩，矩方生繩，繩直生準。　又【書·囧命】繩愆糾謬。【疏】木不正者，以繩正之。繩謂彈正。　又【詩·周南】宜爾子孫繩繩兮。【傳】繩繩，戒愼也。【朱傳】不絕貌。又【大雅】繩其祖武。【傳】繩，戒也。【朱傳】繩，繼也。　又【禮·樂記】省其文采，以繩德厚。【註】繩，猶度也。【史記·樂書註】王肅曰：繩，法也。　又【禮·深衣】負繩及踝以應直。【註】繩謂裻，與後幅相當之縫也。　又【左傳·莊十四年】蔡侯繩息嬀，以語楚子。【註】繩，譽也。【小爾雅】繩之，譽之也。　又【集韻】以證切，音孕。【周禮·秋官·薙氏】秋繩而芟之。【註】含實曰繩。　又【集韻】弭盡切，音泯。繩繩，無涯際貌。一曰運動不絕意。　又【集韻】石證切，音乗。?也。　又【韻補】叶乗

繩字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
繩字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
rope
shéng
See "rope".
rope
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shéng］
["Guangyun" Shiling cut, flat steamed, boat. ]
Also known as "縄1". Traditional characters for "绳1".
(1) Rope.
(2) Woodworking is used to measure straight ink lines.
(3) Straight; upright.
(4) Criterion; law.
(5) Measurement.
(6) Correction; impeachment.
(7) Extended to sanctions.
(8) Constraints.
(9) Binding.
(10) Reputation.
(11) Inheritance.
(12) In ancient times, it was called the center seam of the deep garment.
(13) The name of the water. Now Jinsha River. See "Book of Han·Geography", "Shui Jing Zhuo Shui" by Li Daoyuan of the Northern Wei Dynasty.
(14) The unit of measurement for Qitian in the Qing Dynasty.
[②]［yìng］
["Ji Yun" cuts with evidence, goes to prove, with. ]
Also known as "縄2". Traditional characters for "绳2".
The grass produces seeds. "Zhou Li·Qiuguan·Naushi": "Autumn ropes are used to suffocate them." Zheng Xuan's note: "Including realness means ropes." Lu Deming explained the text: "Rope sound is pregnant, to prove the contradiction."
[③]［mǐn］
["Ji Yun" is completely cut, accurate and clear. ]
Also known as "縄3". Traditional characters for "绳3".
See "rope 3 rope".
rope
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Shizi Department] 　織; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 940 04
[Guang Yun] Shi Ling cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Shen Ling cut, sound multiplication. [Said the text] So also. [Anxiety to the post] The rope is said to have more than two strands. All in all. First, hemp silk is rope, grass is rope. 【Yi·Cici】The ancient times ruled by knotting ropes. 【Book·Said Fate】Only wood is right from the rope. [Li·Jingjie] Shengmo is about Quzhi. [Previous Han·Lüzhi] The rules are round and the rules are generated, the rules are square and the ropes are born, and the ropes are straight and accurate.　[Book·囧命] Rope stunned and ridiculous. 【Sparse】If the wood is not righteous, take the rope to correct it. The rope is said to be right.　[Poetry·Zhou Nan] Yier's descendants are roped and roped. [Biography] Rope rope, quit stunned. [Zhu Chuan] Unstoppable appearance. And [Daya] rope his ancestors. [Biography] Rope, ring also. [Zhu Chuan] Rope, follow also.　[Li·Le Ji] To save his literary talents, and to be virtuous. [Note] The rope is still very good. [Historical Records · Music Notes] Wang Su said: Rope, method.　[Li·Shen Yi] hold the rope and the ankle to make it straight. [Note] The rope is called a twill, which is a seam equivalent to the back panel.　[Zuo Zhuan·14th year of Zhuang] Caihou Shengxizhuo, in the words of Chuzi. [Note] Rope, Yu also. [Xiao Erya] Rope it, and honor it.　[Jiyun] To prove the cut, the sound is pregnant. 【Zhou Li·Qiuguan·Nu's】Autumn rope and 芟. [Note] Including real rope.　[Jiyun] It’s all cut, and the sound is obliterated. Rope rope, endless appearance. One said that the exercise is endless.　[Jiyun] Shizheng cut, sound multiplication. ?and also.　Ye Cheng
